description: An overview of the latest developments and architecture in the City of London via the interactive 1:500 scale Pipers model that shows the future skyline with all of the proposed new towers.

factsheet.heading: The Square Mile's Built Environment
paragraphs: The City Centre is the place to come to learn about and debate the built environment of the Square Mile and home to the City of London’s official architectural model. Through exhibitions, events and learning activity, The City Centre provides access to the City for professionals, the public and young people, helping to inform good decision-making and inspiring young people to engage with the built environment. It is managed by Pipers on behalf of the City of London Corporation.

factsheet.heading: Pipers' City of London Model
paragraphs: The City Centre houses a unique interactive decision making tool, which is often used as the focal point of presentations. The 1:500 scale model of the City offers an essential guide to property in the Square Mile and provides an overview of the entire area. Each property is shown in the context of neighbouring occupants, nearby facilities and public transport. The Touch London model It is a fascinating depiction of a 21st century city built on 2,000 years of history.

location.address: City Centre, within Guildhall Complex (entrance at 80 Basinghall Street, leading from Gresham Street), EC2V 5AR
travel_info: Nearest tube: Bank, Moorgate, St. Paul's, Mansion House

name: The City Centre
